name: depersonalization
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the process of removing from a person, organization, process, etc. the qualities or features that make them special or human: depersonalization of Many job seekers are frustrated at the digital depersonalization of the hiring process. The internet has led to ease of access, but also to the depersonalization of contact between the customer and the shop. Related word
depersonalize
psychology
  specialized a condition in which someone's thoughts or experiences do not feel like they are their own : In both groups of patients, there were bouts of fear, depersonalization, and distortions of perception. When pain becomes very severe, the mind can enter what is known as a "dissociative state", characterized by depersonalization.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bureaucratic model by definition embodies depersonalization. The anonymity of the characters makes the reader feel complicit in the depersonalization of the victims.
